title: Payroll Accounting Specialist
description:
Shift: Night Shift (PST)

Job Type: Full-time / Independent Contractor / Remote



Please Note

Applicants without solid U.S. payroll processing and payroll accounting experience will not be considered.

Strong payroll systems proficiency (Rippling preferred), advanced Excel skills, and hands-on experience with payroll reconciliations, audits, and compliance are required.



About the Role

We are seeking a highly capable Payroll Accounting Specialist to support accurate, timely, and compliant payroll operations for a global workforce. This role sits within the Finance team and partners closely with People, Accounting, and external vendors.



You will own end-to-end payroll processing, payroll accounting, reconciliations, audits, and reporting, while supporting select employee lifecycle activities through close collaboration with the People team.



This role is ideal for someone with a strong payroll and accounting mindset, excellent attention to detail, advanced Excel skills, and the ability to operate confidently in a fast-paced, evolving environment.



What You’ll Do

*Payroll Processing & Administration

Own end-to-end payroll processing for U.S. employees

Ensure payroll accuracy across earnings, deductions, taxes, benefits, equity, commissions, and one-time payments

Coordinate payroll calendars, cutoffs, off-cycle runs, and year-end payroll activities

Partner with payroll vendors and internal teams to resolve payroll issues and employee inquiries



*Payroll Accounting & Reconciliations

Prepare and review payroll journal entries in accordance with U.S. GAAP

Perform payroll balance sheet and expense reconciliations each pay period and month-end

Support payroll accruals, true-ups, and payroll-related estimates

Maintain payroll documentation to support audits and internal controls



*Compliance & Reporting

Ensure compliance with federal, state, and local payroll tax requirements

Support payroll audits, benefits audits, and external financial audits

Assist with W-2, 1099, and other year-end payroll filings

Maintain accurate payroll records and supporting schedules



*Systems & Data Management

Administer payroll and HRIS systems, with a focus on data integrity and controls

Partner on system testing, implementations, and payroll process improvements

Maintain accurate employee data related to payroll, compensation, and benefits



*Cross-Functional People Support

Partner with the People team on onboarding, offboarding, and employee changes impacting payroll

Support benefits and leave programs as they relate to payroll processing and deductions

Assist with headcount reporting, budgeting support, and workforce analytics



*Ad Hoc Analysis & Projects

Build payroll reports and models using advanced Excel

Support special projects related to payroll transformation, system upgrades, and process standardization



Who You Are

A clear and professional communicator

Service-oriented and responsive to employee needs

Highly detail-oriented with strong follow-through

Organized and comfortable managing recurring payroll deadlines

Proactive and effective working across Finance and People teams

Adaptable and confident in evolving environments



Required Education, Experience, and Skills

3–5+ years of experience in payroll processing and payroll accounting

Strong understanding of U.S. payroll, taxes, and wage compliance

Hands-on experience preparing payroll journal entries and reconciliations

Advanced Excel skills (pivot tables, VLOOKUP/XLOOKUP, complex formulas)

Experience working with payroll systems and HRIS platforms (Rippling preferred)

Experience supporting audits and maintaining payroll controls

Ability to analyze payroll data and clearly explain variances



Preferred Education, Experience, and Skills

Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, or a related field

Experience supporting multi-state and international payroll

Prior experience in a high-growth or startup environment

Familiarity with payroll treatment for benefits, equity, and commissions

title: Growth Systems Owner (WordPress, Elementor & GoHighLevel)
description:
About nutrition.fitness

nutrition.fitness is a comprehensive SaaS platform and mobile application that integrates training programmes, nutrition, and educational content into a single, cohesive system. It is specifically designed to serve both individuals and coaches who value structure and guidance, moving away from generic plans and disconnected applications.

Integrated Training and Nutrition.



The platform provides users with guided workouts and macro-based nutrition planning, including meal preparation guidance. All features are underpinned by a robust onboarding process, ensuring that targets are not arbitrary. Instead, calorie, macro, and programme settings are determined by each user's goals, training regime, and lifestyle. This synergy means that training and nutrition are directly connected: as users progress through workouts, their calorie requirements and food logging targets are updated daily. This dynamic approach allows users to clearly see what has changed in their plan and understand the reasons behind those adjustments.



nutrition.fitness offers a range of innovative features, including AI-powered coaching, fridge and plate scanning for meal tracking, and comprehensive tracking for both food and supplements. Built-in educational resources are also available to help users deepen their understanding. The platform's aim is not to replace the decision-making process, but to reduce friction and support users in understanding their actions as they progress.



The service is accessible as both a web application and a mobile app, providing visibility and management tools for coaches and administrators. Every component of the platform is intentionally designed to work together, supporting users in achieving long-term results and sustained engagement, rather than offering short-lived hype.



What You’ll Actually Do 



You will be responsible for two main areas:



GoHighLevel



• Ensure the platform is set up properly, not just partially functional or left for future tidying.

• Guarantee that funnels are live and automations are running smoothly.

• Connect forms and calendars, ensuring pipelines are logical and understandable by others.

• Prioritise simplicity; if something is clever but confusing, it’s incorrect.



WordPress + Elementor



• Improve the website’s appearance, making it clearer, more confident, and avoiding the impression of a hastily built site.

• We are talking header front page and footer and theme. Some page templates if needed.

• Design skills are not mandatory, but having taste, sound judgement, and the willingness to fix poor visuals is essential.

• Use Canva as needed to enhance pages and funnels, avoiding unnecessary over-design.

• Outcomes will be specified; you d
 on the best approach to achieve them.



How We Work (Important)



• This is a relaxed role as long as deliverables are met.

• Work hours, duration, and location are flexible.

• What matters is that tasks are completed, functions work, and systems are tidy.

• Thinking, delivering, and communicating will earn support.

• If you encounter challenges, ask for help.

• If you notice issues, take initiative to fix them.

• If you have better ideas, share them.

• Using your brain is central to this position.

• We make each other’s lives easier.

• Don’t give details, give deliverables that make me go wow.



The First Month (“Get Shit Done” Trial)



This position begins with a one-month trial period focused on results:

• By the end of the month, High-level should be set up and functional.

• Funnels and automations must be live.

• The website should have a noticeably stronger look and feel.

• The aim is to have systems set up and working not perfect, not endlessly tweaked.

Success leads to collective rewards and the opportunity for the role to expand long-term. There are no empty promises results lead to tangible benefits.



How to Apply 



• Do not send a polished cover letter, a CV full of jargon, or anything generated by AI these are instant rejections.

• Instead, visit nutrition.fitness and share your honest thoughts: what is confusing, what is weak, and what you would change first if it were your product. If you don’t understand that’s intentional.

• Describe your approach to the first month: how you would set up GoHighLevel, where you would focus, and what you would deliberately leave alone for now.

• Explain what “owning a role” means to you in practical terms give a real example, not a quote or slogan.

• Rough writing, bullet points, and imperfect English are acceptable even a video - clear thinking is mandatory.



Final Reality Check



• This role offers autonomy, trust, support, and the chance to build something you can be proud of.

• Delivery is key success depends on getting things done.

• If this makes you nervous, good! If this excites you, apply. If you find these expectations bothersome, don’t fucking apply. 



That’s it plain and simple

title: Virtual Assistant – Sales/Marketing Focus
description:
Job Summary:

We are seeking a highly motivated and versatile Virtual Assistant (VA) with a strong focus on

Sales and Marketing support. This multi-role position is critical to maintaining efficient sales

operations and driving marketing outreach. The ideal candidate will possess excellent

organizational skills, a keen eye for data integrity, and familiarity with key sales enablement

tools.



Key Responsibilities:



The VA will perform a variety of tasks that offer significant overlap between sales administration

and marketing research, including, but not limited to:



* CRM Management: Handle daily administration and maintenance of our CRM systems

(e.g., HubSpot and/or Salesforce), ensuring all data is accurate, compliant, and

up-to-date.

* Lead Generation: Execute targeted lead generation campaigns and activities using

industry-standard tools such as ZoomInfo and LinkedIn Sales Navigator.

* Market Research: Conduct in-depth market research to support the preparation of

Requests for Proposals (RFPs) and analyze relevant industry and competitor trends.

* Data Integrity & Compliance: Oversee the integrity and quality of data within the CRM

and other sales platforms, adhering strictly to data compliance standards.

* Administrative Support: Provide general administrative assistance to the Sales and

Marketing teams as needed.





Qualifications & Requirements:



* Proven experience as a Virtual Assistant or similar administrative role, preferably with a

focus on Sales or Marketing.

* Demonstrated proficiency in major CRM platforms (HubSpot and/or Salesforce).

* Experience utilizing lead generation tools (e.g., ZoomInfo, LinkedIn Sales Navigator).

* Strong research and analytical skills for gathering market intelligence.

* Exceptional attention to detail and a commitment to data accuracy and compliance.

* Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

* Ability to manage multiple tasks, prioritize effectively, and work independently.





To fast track your application, please submit the following information:

Resume: A link to your Google Drive. Please ensure the sharing setting is set to "Anyone with the link."

WhatsApp Number: Your contact number.

Work Sample: A link to your drive, if available.

title: Sales Operations Analyst
description:
Job Summary:  



We are seeking a primary architect for our market expansion. This role is responsible for identifying new opportunities, deep diving into school district procurement data, and maintaining the data integrity of our sales database. The ideal candidate loves the "hunt" for information and understands how to organize complex data into actionable sales leads. 





Key Responsibilities:

  

1.  Market Prospecting & Lead Generation  

* Conduct deep-dive research to identify and compile key contact information for decision-makers in assigned markets.  

* Verify and validate lead data to ensure the sales team is reaching the correct  

stakeholders.  

2. District Intelligence & Bid Research  

* Investigate and document the landscape of specific school districts, focusing on existing ice cream programs and vendor history.  

* Identify and map Cooperative Buying Groups and procurement cycles.  

* Monitor and gather details on upcoming bids and RFPs, ensuring the sales team is prepared for critical deadlines.  

3. Data Management & Reporting  

* Own the organization of the Share Drive, ensuring all contact listings are current and standardized.  

* Meticulously record all research progress, lead status, and outreach history to provide a "single source of truth" for the department.  

4. Collaboration  

* Work closely with the School Business Development Manager (BDM) to coordinate efforts for large districts





Key Skills and Qualifications:  



* Research Skills: Ability to conduct thorough research to gather accurate and relevant information about potential clients using AI, e-mail and the provided contact listing.  

* Organizational Skills: Strong organizational skills to manage multiple tasks and maintain detailed records.  

* Data Integrity: High attention to detail  

* Tech Savvy: Proficiency in using Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, Word, PowerPoint) and CRM software.  

* Collaboration: Team player with the ability to work collaboratively with other departments and tea
mbers.  

* Adaptability: Flexibility to adapt to changing priorities and business needs.  

* Self-Motivation: Highly motivated and proactive, with a strong drive to achieve sales targets and goals. 



Preferred Qualifications:  

* Previous experience in inside sales or a related field  

* Internet search processes   

* Experience with maintaining database for sales leads





To fast track your application, please submit the following information:

Resume: A link to your Google Drive. Please ensure the sharing setting is set to "Anyone with the link."

Performance Marketing & Social Media Manager (Etsy + Google Focus)
description:
We are a growing handcrafted woodworking brand specializing in custom furniture, epoxy tables, and charcuterie boards. Our focus is on high-quality, custom pieces, and we are looking to scale SALES, not just views or followers.



We are hiring a performance-driven marketing and social media manager whose main responsibility is helping generate consistent table sales through content, listings, and traffic strategies.



This role is ideal for someone who understands how short-form video, long-form YouTube content, Etsy optimization, and Google marketing work together to drive real customers.



Our goals



Get more SALES, not just views

Grow TikTok, Instagram,
, and YouTube Shorts

Build a strong YouTube presence with long-form video

Drive traffic through Google and other effective channels



Your responsibilities



Edit and post short-form videos (TikTok, Instagram Reels, YouTube Shorts)

Edit and publish long-form YouTube videos to support brand growth and sales

Write captions and hashtags designed to drive engagement and clicks

Research, help set up, and optimize Google marketing

Optimize Etsy and online product listings for conversions

Suggest and test additional ways to bring in customers

Track performance and clearly explain why strategies are working or not



What we provide



Daily raw video clips from our workshop

Clear direction on products, pricing, and brand style

Long-term, stable work with growth opportunities

Performance-based incentives tied to real sales



Important



We are not looking for someone who only posts content.

We want someone who can explain why they are doing something and how it helps drive sales.

Sales results matter more than follower counts.



Compensation



$1,000 USD per month base pay

Performance bonuses available for additional high-ticket table sales beyond weekly targets

Bonuses are paid on completed and fully paid orders only



Work hours



30–40 hours per week

Work hours are tracked using Timeproof for transparency and fairness



Please include examples of short-form content, long-form videos, ads, or marketing campaigns you have worked on.

title: Real Estate Inside Sales Agent
description:
Real Estate Virtual Assistant - Full-Time Inside Sales Agent

(Must have prior real estate experience)



Our St. Louis, MO, USA-based Real Estate Investments company, with over a decade in real estate investing, is seeking a dedicated and experienced real estate professional to join our growing team! If you enjoy negotiating deals, have a proven track record in real estate sales, and are looking for a remote opportunity where you can make an impact, please read the details and apply below by reading the how to apply instructions.



Job Description:

We are hiring for the position of Real Estate Inside Sales Agent. In this role, you will work remotely and be responsible for speaking with homeowners, gathering property information, negotiating offers, and securing contracts for our investment properties. Your main focus will be on acquiring distressed properties at favorable terms by getting property info, making offers, negotiating deals, and diligently following up to close sales. You will use your sales expertise and relationship-building skills to engage potential sellers, gather necessary information, and document interactions in our CRM system.



Responsibilities:

- Conduct outbound calls and send
s to manage real estate buying opportunities.

- Make offers to potential sellers and negotiate terms to get our offers accepted.

- Follow up on all leads and negotiations to ensure deal closure.

- Utilize effective sales strategies and scripts to handle objections and convey our company’s value proposition.

- Maintain detailed records of all interactions and negotiations in our CRM system.

- Collaborate with other tea
mbers to ensure seamless transaction processes.



Qualifications:

- High Energy and Enthusiastic Personality: You thrive in a fast-paced, engaging environment.

- 2+ Years of Real Estate Sales and Negotiations Experience: Proven background in closing deals.

- Exceptional English Communication Skills: Fluent in both written and verbal English.

- Fearless Negotiator: Eager to engage in challenging conversations, overcome objections, and secure agreements.

- Organized and Detail-Oriented: Excellent time management skills.

- Technologically Proficient: Experience using CRM systems and quick to learn new technologies.

- Problem Solver: Ability to navigate complex negotiations effectively.



System Requirements:

- Reliable high-speed laptop or desktop computer.

- DSL Internet connection with a minimum speed of 40+ Mbps.

- Noise-canceling headset.

- Must have a dedicated quiet home office setup



Performance Metrics:

- Talk to a certain number of sellers daily, weekly, and monthly.

- Achieve a target number of accepted offers each month.

- Consistently follow up to close deals within expected timeframes.



Career Growth & Training:

- Opportunities for advancement into leadership roles for high-performing individuals.

- Professional training provided to enhance your skills.



Company Culture:

- Dynamic and Collaborative: We value teamwork, integrity, and a drive for excellence.

- Supportive Environment: We believe in ongoing professional growth and celebrating achievements.

- High Ethical Standards: We conduct business with honesty and transparency.



What We’re Looking For:

- Self-motivated professionals with a positive attitude.

- Candidates with a dedicated home office setup.

- Ability to thrive in a remote role with excellent time management skills.

- Experience in real estate sales



What We’re Not Looking For:

- Candidates who cannot commit to our specified working hours: Monday to Friday, 9 AM - 6 PM CST.

- Minimal Communication Skills: If you struggle with fluent English communication, both written and verbal.

- Lack of Self-Motivation and Enthusiasm.

- Candidates unfamiliar with CRMs and resistant to learning new systems or scripts.

- Candidates with inconsistent internet and power supply or a disruptive workspace.

- Candidates who are easily flustered, shy, or fearful when making calls.

- Offline or Non-Voice Preference: This is a phone-based sales position.



Pay Rate:

Starting up to $6/hr, with performance bonuses. Pay is issued on the 1st and 15th of each month (CST).



Working Hours:

Monday to Friday, 9 AM - 6 PM CST. A 30-minute lunch break and two 15-minute breaks per shift.



How to Apply: (Submit Your Resume and Introduction)

-
 your updated resume and a brief personalized audio or video recording to: 

- Use the subject line "Real Estate Application - Inside Sales Agent"

- In your recording, introduce yourself and explain why you are a great fit for this role.

- Attach a recent internet speed test result and a photo of your home office setup to verify your system readiness.



= Important Note: Only complete applications that follow all the instructions will be considered. We look forward to reviewing your application! =

description:
The Mission



Northline Labs is scaling paid search and we’re hiring a Microsoft Ads (Bing) Specialist who knows how to drive high-intent traffic for regulated or gray-area products—without blowing up accounts.



This role is about precision and compliance, not spray-and-pray keywords.



What You’ll Be Responsible For



Build, launch, and manage Microsoft Ads campaigns (Search + Audience Network)



Keyword research focused on buyer intent, not curiosity clicks



Ad copy that passes Bing policy while still converting



Landing page alignment and CRO feedback



Smart use of negatives, match types, and bid strategies



Scaling spend without triggering compliance issues



Weekly reporting with clear “keep / kill / scale” decisions



You’re a Fit If You Have



Proven experience running Microsoft/Bing Ads (not just Google)



Experience with regulated, restricted, or gray-area offers



Strong understanding of Bing Ads policies and enforcement patterns



Ability to manage and scale accounts responsibly



Zero ego around testing, cutting losers, and moving fast



Big Plus If You’ve Worked With



Peptides, supplements, biohacking, or research chemicals



Alternative health or performance products



Policy-sensitive niches where wording matters



What This Is NOT



Not a beginner role



Not for agencies that outsource execution



Not a “set it and forget it” account



Compensation



Competitive hourly or monthly retainer



Performance incentives tied to ROAS / CPA



Long-term upside if you can scale cleanly



How to Apply



Send:



Your Microsoft Ads experience



Screenshots or examples of past Bing campaigns



Keywords you’d start with for a research peptide brand and why



Any experience dealing with policy restrictions



If you know how to extract value from Bing without tripping compliance wires, we want you.

title: Direct Message Online Setter Make $1,200+  USD a month from home.
description:
Direct Message Online Setter

Make $1,200–$2,000+  USD a month from home.

If you’re tired of driving to work and want a simple online job with real growth, this is it.We’re hiring someone who types fast, pays attention, and enjoys talking to people in Instagram DMs.

Schedule

Mon–Fri: 8 AM–5 PM CT

You must be online during these hours.

What You’ll Do

Reply fast to people in our DMs, likes, comments, and new followers

Send 10+ good messages every hour

Follow our simple steps (SOP) to qualify people

Put info into our Google Sheets and CRM

Type real messages (no copy + paste AI)

Tell us quickly if something breaks

Turn in a daily report

You’re a Good Fit If You…

Write English well

Are friendly and good with people

Have strong internet + a backup

Have a backup power plan

Type fast and stay organized

Can focus full-time (not juggling jobs)

Have DM experience (not required but helpful)

Tools We Use

Instagram, Meta Business Suite, Google Sheets, Google Docs, Slack, Asana

Pay

You can make $1,200 + per month.

Base Pay: $250/month ($125 every two weeks)

If you miss days: $30 deduction

Bonus: $50 per closed deal (with perfect attendance)

Extra Bonuses:

5 closes = +$100

10 closes = +$200

15 closes = +$300

20 closes = +$500

title: Entry-Level Outbound Callers
description:
Looking to hire two entry level Outbound Callers to our team. No sales experience necessary but you need to know how to speak well on the phone and be consistent! This is for a B2B North American contract and is a full-time PERMENANT position. You will be calling businesses, building relationships, qualifying leads, and handing off opportunities to the closing team.



This is a home-based position. Candidates must have a quiet workspace, personal computer, stable high-speed internet (minimum 20 Mbps download/upload), and a noise-cancelling headset.



Key Responsibilities

• Make high-volume (
) outbound calls (cold and warm outreach) to qualify decision makers

• Pre-qualify opportunities and set up next steps for the closing team

• Follow up with leads consistently via phone,
, fax

• Send marketing materials and maintain professional communication with prospects

• Maintain accurate notes, call logs, and pipeline updates in the CRM

• Perform other tasks as required by management



Qualifications

• University/college degree required

• Excellent English communication skills (spoken, written, comprehension)

• Confident phone presence with professional etiquette

• Organized, self-motivated, and able to hit activity and performance targets

• Comfortable using computers daily



Compensation

Base salary range is between 20,000 to 23,000 PHP per month (dependent on experience) + generous incentive program. Incentives are targeted at 10,000 PHP extra per month when agents hit minimum criteria, plus additional bonus for order size. Base pay is paid out bi-weekly, whereas bonuses are paid out monthly.



Schedule

Monday to Friday, 9:00 AM–5:00 PM EST



How to Apply

Please submit your current CV and 20-second voice recording. If sending a shared link, please ensure that the link works prior to submission.

title: YouTube Longform Video Editor
description:
We’re hiring a YouTube editor for simple educational / explainer / commentary videos (3–8 minutes).



This role is ideal for someone early in their editing career who wants:



- Consistent work

- Clear instructions

-  Training and feedback

- Long-term stability (not one-off gigs)



If you’re looking for quick money with minimal effort, this is not for you.



---

What you’ll be editing:



3–5 min and 5–8 min videos

Tutorials, explainers, educational commentary

Straightforward structure (no cinematic editing)



Editing style:



Clean cuts, good pacing

Remove mistakes, pauses, filler

Basic zooms, light b-roll, simple captions when needed

Clear audio (nothing fancy)



---



You are a good fit if:



-You actually want to work and improve

-You follow instructions properly

-You don’t disappear mid-task

-You’re open to feedback and corrections

-You value consistency over ego



You do not need to be advanced - skill can be taught.

Reliability cannot.

title: Azure DevOps Engineer – Cloud Automation & CI/CD (FINTECH) | Remote
description:
Azure DevOps Engineer (Azure | CI/CD | Automation)



Remote | Canadian FINTECH | High-Impact Role



Build. Automate. Secure. Scale.

L’EVATE Inc., on behalf of a leading Canadian FINTECH innovator, is looking for a senior Azure DevOps Engineer who thrives in cloud-native, automation-first environments and wants to work on mission-critical financial platforms—100% remotely.



If you are passionate about CI/CD excellence, Infrastructure as Code, and secure DevOps at scale, this role gives you the opportunity to shape modern fintech systems used by real customers, not proof-of-concepts.



Why This Role Is Exciting



Own end-to-end DevOps pipelines powering production fintech platforms

Work with modern Azure PaaS and AKS architectures

Be a DevOps leader, not just a ticket closer

Collaborate with senior engineers in an agile, engineering-driven culture

Deliver real impact, not maintenance work



What You’ll Be Doing

CI/CD & Automation Excellence



Design, build, and optimize robust CI/CD pipelines using Azure DevOps, GitHub Actions, or similar

Automate build, test, deployment, monitoring, and rollback strategies

Ensure environment consistency through pipeline-driven releases



Azure Infrastructure & IaC



Develop and maintain Infrastructure as Code using Bicep, ARM, or Terraform

Automate provisioning and management of:

App Services, Azure Functions, AKS

Key Vault, Application Gateway, Azure SQL

Enforce cloud governance, cost controls, tagging, and policies



Security, Compliance & Reliability



Embed security by design into pipelines (secrets management, scanning, code analysis)

Ensure compliance with ISO, SOC2, and OWASP standards

Manage access via RBAC, Managed Identities, and Azure AD



Monitoring & I
 Response



Implement proactive monitoring with Azure Monitor, Application Insights, and Log Analytics

Build alerting strategies to detect issues before users do

Support i
 response, RCA, and continuous improvement



Agile Collaboration & DevOps Leadership



Partner with developers, QA, and product teams in agile ceremonies

Champion DevOps best practices across teams

Mentor teams on pipelines, releases, and onboarding new services



What We’re Looking For

Required

5+ years in Azure-focused DevOps roles

Strong experience with Azure DevOps, YAML pipelines, and CI/CD automation

Proven expertise in Bicep, Terraform, or ARM templates

Deep hands-on knowledge of Azure PaaS and AKS

Solid understanding of cloud networking (DNS, load balancing, VPNs, firewalls)

Scripting skills in PowerShell, Bash, or Python

Strong grasp of secure DevOps practices



Nice to Have



Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or equivalent experience

Azure certifications (AZ-400 preferred)

Docker, Kubernetes, Helm experience

Strong observability mindset (metrics, tracing, centralized logging)



Why Join L’EVATE & Our FINTECH Partner



Fully remote role with a high-performing Canadian FINTECH team

Work on modern, real-world financial systems, not legacy cleanup

Career growth in cloud, automation, and security at scale

Collaborative, engineering-first culture that values quality and ownership
